name: GenerateGithubReleaseNotes
description:
Generate release notes for a GitHub repository.

This tool generates a markdown-formatted name and body for release notes, detailing changes since the last release and contributor information. It's useful when preparing to create a new release but does not save the notes.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the GitHub repository. This is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository. It is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: release_tag_name
parameters.description: Specify the tag name for the release. Can be an existing tag or a new one.

value_schema.description: The tag name for the release. This can be an existing tag or a new one.

parameters.name: release_configuration_file_path
parameters.description: Path to the configuration file in the repository for generating release notes. Defaults to '.github/release.yml' or '.github/release.yaml' if not specified.

value_schema.description: Specifies a path to a file in the repository containing configuration settings used for generating the release notes. If unspecified, the configuration file located in the repository at '.github/release.yml' or '.github/release.yaml' will be used. If that is not present, the default configuration will be used.

parameters.name: previous_tag_name
parameters.description: The name of the previous tag to use as the starting point for the release notes. It specifies the range of changes for this release.

value_schema.description: The name of the previous tag to use as the starting point for the release notes. Use to manually specify the range for the set of changes considered as part this release.

parameters.name: target_commit
parameters.description: The commitish value that will target the release's tag. Required if tag_name doesn't reference an existing tag. Otherwise, it's ignored.

value_schema.description: Specifies the commitish value that will be the target for the release's tag. Required if the supplied tag_name does not reference an existing tag. Ignored if the tag_name already exists.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: configuration_file_path
parameters.description: Specifies a path to a file in the repository containing configuration settings used for generating the release notes. If unspecified, the configuration file located in the repository at '.github/release.yml' or '.github/release.yaml' will be used. If that is not present, the default configuration will be used.

value_schema.description: Specifies a path to a file in the repository containing configuration settings used for generating the release notes. If unspecified, the configuration file located in the repository at '.github/release.yml' or '.github/release.yaml' will be used. If that is not present, the default configuration will be used.

parameters.name: previous_tag_name
parameters.description: The name of the previous tag to use as the starting point for the release notes. Use to manually specify the range for the set of changes considered as part this release.

value_schema.description: The name of the previous tag to use as the starting point for the release notes. Use to manually specify the range for the set of changes considered as part this release.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: The tag name for the release. This can be an existing tag or a new one.

value_schema.description: The tag name for the release. This can be an existing tag or a new one.

parameters.name: target_commitish
parameters.description: Specifies the commitish value that will be the target for the release's tag. Required if the supplied tag_name does not reference an existing tag. Ignored if the tag_name already exists.

value_schema.description: Specifies the commitish value that will be the target for the release's tag. Required if the supplied tag_name does not reference an existing tag. Ignored if the tag_name already exists.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
